Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, embutidos, y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Las Emprendedoras” (The Entrepreneurs) committee was formed over a year ago by 12 very hardworking, enterprising women.  They are very happy to be part of Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women program and want to continue growing with their projects.

Susana is one of the group members.  She’s a merchant.  She has a well-stocked grocery store that with much sacrifice and effort she’s been carrying forward.  Her goal is to continue growing and helping her family by this means.

She requests the loan to buy beverages, dairy products, canned goods, cured meats and other supplies to continue providing a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 35 years old and is married with two children. He sells various goods, such as lotions, cakes, soap, cooking oil, etc. in his store. His store is open from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except on Saturday. He currently employs three people to help him. He has 2 years of experience in this work. 

Vedaste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods, such as lotions, cakes, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as lotions, cakes, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en: Batdorj, 52, has been running a clothes selling business with his wife since 1995. At night he operates a taxi around town, which helps greatly to increase his family's monthly earnings. Batdorj lives with his wife and daughter in a shared apartment. His car is an old car to use for a taxi business, and lately it has been running poorly. This influences his service quality and business earnings for the worse, so Batdorj has decided he would like to buy spare parts for car repair. It will cost about 2,700,000 MNT. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to repairing his car.

loans.use: to repair his taxi car.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 40-year-old married man with four children, aged between three and 19 years old. He describes himself as a man who is ambitious, courageous and a go-getter. He operates a retail business selling animals such as goats, chickens, and ducks. Michael has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. His business is strategically located and his primary customers are butchers and farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be outbreak of diseases. Michael will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay for the construction of a house for his chickens. Michael's dream and business goal is to be a dairy farmer and supplier of milk.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a chicken house.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 29 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 6 years, Juma has been working hard to manage his small business, which does carpentry. 

To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wood for making beds for resale, and will help Juma to generate greater profits and make more furniture. Juma hopes that in the future he will be able to borrow  more money again after completing. 

Juma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more wood for making beds for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 38 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children. Two of his children are currently in school. For the past 16 years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale and will help David to generate greater profits and expand his business. David hopes that in the future he will be able to become a wholeseller. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre muy trabajador a sus 40 años de edad el tiene una alegría de un joven de 20 años, es padre de familia y junto a su esposa quiere y ama a sus 2 hijos los cuales tienen 16 y 8 años de edad , por los cuales trabaja de sol a sol por sacarlos adelante para verlos felices y con una buena calidad de vida, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú, el distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores así como también por poseer el bosque de piedras, el cual es un conjunto  Cerros en formas de animales, personas, entre otros. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello su platillo favorito es la riquísima Sopa Seca. Debido a los pocos recursos de sus padres Walter solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Día a día Walter trabaja en su negocio como maestro de construcción, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 2 clientes al día según el tipo y tamaño de construcción que realice; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y es muy responsable con los clientes.

Walter está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda y podrá comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos, con esta mejora el podrá ofrecerle una mejor vivienda a su familia y sus hijos podrán tener los útiles necesarios para ir a la escuela; así el podrá seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Walter is a very hardworking man who at the age of 40 has the joy of a twenty-year-old.  He’s a father and together with his wife loves his two children who are 16 and 8 years old.  He works sunrise to sunrise in order to move them forward and to see them happy with a good quality of life.  

His house is located in Parcona District in Ica, Perú.  Parcona District is noted for the kindness of its inhabitants but also for the Stone Forest which is a collection of hills in the shape of animals and persons, among others.  Like all good Peruvians he enjoys our country’s typical food very much and his favorite dish is the very delicious “sopa seca.” Due to his parents’ scarce resources, Walter was only able to finish fifth year of secondary school but he would have liked to have studied Law.

Walter works day to day in his business as a master builder.  He works about 8 hours per day and can take care of up to two customers per day according to the type and size of the construction job he does.  He believes that he does well in his business because he does good work and is very responsible with his customers.

Walter is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided him he will be able to do some improvements to his house and buy his children’s school supplies.  With this improvement he will be able to provide a better home for his family and his children will have the necessary supplies to go to school and he will be able to continue striving day to day to make his greatest dream a reality:  “To have a house of his own.”

loans.use: to do some home improvements and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 34 years old and is married with five children between 8 and 17 years old. She sells cows and she has been in this business for eight years. She currently employs four people to help her, and her business is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. all week except in the weekend. 

Elina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her cow-breeding business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to reinvest in her business, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her cow breeding business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina es una mujer muy entusiasta y sobre todo valiente , es madre de un pequeño de 2 años de edad al cual cría sola ya que es madre soltera y desde que nació se convirtió en madre y padre para su hijo y por lo cual trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para ver a su hijo hecho una persona de bien y sobre todo feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas playas hermosas, un clima cálido, por su agricultura , en especial el cultivo de arroz y también por su pesca y sobre todo por los exquisitos Camarones. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida y su plato favorito es el riquísimo “Pollo al Vino, asimismo cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mirar películas para distraerse un poco.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Celina trabaja en su negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día sobre todo cuando son días festivos ya que los clientes en estas fechas consumen mas carne de cerdo; ella cree que l va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora y porque atiende de manera amable a los clientes.

Celina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar alimentos balanceados para los cerdos así como también realizar mejoras al corral donde cría a los cerdos; con esta mejora podrá seguir dándole una buena alimentación a los animales y criarlos en un espacio apropiado, así los clientes sentirán más confianza y seguirán comprando sus productos, con lo cual Celina seguirá luchando día a día para hacer cumplir su más grande sueño.” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una vida feliz”.
texts.en:
Celina is an enthusiastic but above all brave woman.  She’s the mother of a little two year old boy who she raises by herself since she’s a single mother and since he was born she became both mother and father for her son; she works with much effort to see her son become an upstanding citizen and above all to be happy.

Her house is located in the city of Camana, a city noted for having beautiful beaches, hot climate, for its agriculture especially rice growing, and also for its fishing and above all for its delicious shrimp.  Like all good Peruvian women she enjoys food very much and her favorite dish is the very delicious “Pollo al Vino.”  When she has free time she likes to watch movies to entertain herself a little.

With much effort and dedication, Celina works raising pigs to sell.  She works about 12 hours daily and can tend to up to 10 customers per day especially during feast days because customers consume more pork on those occasions.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very hardworking and because she treats her customers very kindly.

Celina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they have given her she will be able to buy nutritionally balanced pig feed as well as to make some improvements to the corral where she keeps the pigs.  With this improvement she will be able to continue to provide good nutrition to the animals and raise them in an appropriate space so that customers will be more inclined to buy her products so that Celina can continue striving day to day to reach her greatest dream:  “To give her son a good education and a happy life.”

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to repair her corral.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou est une dame de 42 ans qui fait du commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle vend des produits alimentaires tels que le poisson fumé et séché, de l’huile de palme. Elle se ravitaille dans un marché hebdomadaire ou une variété de produits sont offertes. Elle vend aussi du savon artisanal comme on voit sur la photo.Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000F CFA  pour honorer une commande.
Seynabou n’a pas de charges  sinon ces charges personnelles. Elle travaille pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer.
texts.en:
Madame Seynabou is 42 years old, and has been selling food for 5 years. She is married and has a family. Seynabou sells products such as smoked and dried fish, and palm oil. She obtains her supplies at a weekly market where she can find a variety of products. She also sells home-made soap, as seen in the photo. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to be able to fill an order.
Seynabou has no other financial responsibilities besides her own expenses. She works in order to provide more food for her family.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, palm oil, and dried fish.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.es:
La  Sra. Tecla es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella tiene una despensa y nos comenta que trabaja en esto hace más de 12 años, por lo que ya tiene un buen conocimiento sobre este negocio.
Ella nos comenta que tiene una gran  clientela formada  y que es  la única despensa del barrio; es un verdadero sacrificio  ya que madruga para realizar sus compras; de esta manera abaratar el costo de sus productos y obtener menores ganancias. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante. Tecla, con este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos.
Ella necesita de este crédito para la compra  de carne, pollo, gaseosas, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos que necesita para poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Tecla is from the city of San Lorenzo.  She has a grocery store and she tells us that she’s been in business for more than 12 years so she has good knowledge of this business.

She comments that she has an established good clientele and that it’s the only grocery store in the neighborhood.  It’s quite a sacrifice because she must rise at dawn to do her purchases so that she can lower her costs and be able to make higher profits. 

She defines herself as a very hardworking, tenacious woman who always strives to get ahead.  Through her work, Tecla has managed to make some home improvements and provide her children with the necessary schooling.

She needs this loan to buy meat, chicken, soft-drinks, dairy products, baked goods and other supplies she needs to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesus se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para poder fomentar su compañerismo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de trabajar juntas para lograr sus metas.
La Señora Romualda es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a elaborar helados y vender, también vende comidas en lo que le va muy bien.  Ella ya no tiene hijos chicos y su marido es pintor de autos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y vendiendo los alimentos que hace. Agradece la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño Jesús” (Divine Child Jesus) committee formed thanks to several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All the members of the committee carry out their independent activities but they also do group activities to foster their fellowship.  The members formed a very united group that’s capable of working together to reach their goals.

Romualda is one of the committee members.  She makes frozen treats to sell and also sells food; she does very well.  She does not have minor children and her husband paints cars.

She requests the loan to buy meat, condiments, baked goods and other supplies to continue working and selling the food she makes.  She is grateful for the opportunity they are getting because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, baked goods and other supplies.

loans.name: Segundo Lino

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de 54 años, viudo y a cargo de dos hijos. Viven en la parroquia de "Ignacio Flores" de "Latacunga" que es la capital de la provincia de "Cotopaxi" ubicada en el centro del Ecuador. Este sector, el cual se encuentra en plena cordillera de los andes, tiene una población muy tradicional y dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería. En Latacunga, por encontrarse a unos 2.800 metros sobre el nivel del mar el clima suele ser gélido, pero subtropical en el lado occidental de la provincia, el clima es cálido húmedo por su cercanía a la región costanera del país. Una de las fiestas más sonadas y populares es la de la "Mama Negra" en la cual es propiamente la independencia de Latacunga, sin embargo la celebración va más allá ya que es una mezcla de religión, manifestaciones paganas, españolas e incluso africanas; por este motivo, la celebración cuenta con un gran colorido que se representa en el desfile tradicional que se da a cabo en septiembre, en los días 23, 24, día del equinoccio de otoño.

La muerte de su esposa ha hecho que Segundo tenga una vida nada fácil, ya que ha tenido que ser padre y madre para sus hijos, sin embargo ha sabido salir adelante ya que se destaca por ser un hombre trabajador. Desde hace 12 años Segundo se dedica a la crianza de animales, que es un oficio que lo aprendió de sus familiares que tenían la misma actividad.

Para poder tener mayores ingresos, Segundo desea invertir en alimento balanceado para sus cerdos. De esta manera el tendrá animales grandes y bien alimentados para poder venderlos. Aunque trabaja sin ayuda, Segundo es optimista y está seguro de que con esta inversión su calidad de vida mejorará y con ello la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 54 year old man, a widower with two children in his care.  They live in Ignacio Flores Parish in Latacunga which is the capital of Cotopaxi Province in central Ecuador.  

This sector which is found in the middle of the Andes has a very traditional population dedicated primarily to agriculture and animal husbandry.  Because Latacunga is at an elevation of 2800 meters above sea level the weather tends to be frigid but it’s subtropical on the west of the province; it’s warm and humid due to its proximity to the country’s coastal region.  

One of the better known, most popular festivals is “Mama Negra” which properly celebrates Latacunga’s independence.  However, the celebration goes much further than that since it’s a mixture of religion, pagan both Spanish and even African celebrations .  Because of this the celebration is very colorful as noted in the traditional parade that takes place on September 23 and 24, the Fall Equinox.

The death of Segundo’s wife has caused his life to be not at all an easy one because he’s had to be both father and mother for his children.  However, he’s known how to overcome and stands out for being a hardworking man.  For the last 12 years Segundo has worked raising animals which is an occupation he learned from his family who were in the same occupation.

In order to earn higher income, Segundo wants to invest in nutritionally balanced feed for his pigs so that he will have big, well-nourished animals to sell.  Although he works with no help, Segundo is optimistic and sure that with this investment his quality of life will improve and with it so will the quality of life of his children.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 21 años muy entusiasta y trabajador, vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, Ica, Perú, este distrito se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, así como también por el carisma y amabilidad de sus pobladores; como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio; el estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica.

Día a día Luis sale a trabajar en su negocio como chofer, se dedica alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes el  día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y también porque hay muchos clientes ya que es temporada escolar.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá Dar la cuota inicial para comprar una mototaxi propia, ya que actualmente la que maneja es alquilada; con esta mejora el podrá tener más ingresos y poder tener un vehículo propio, así el seguirá luchando cada día para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia, una casa y formar una familia”.
texts.en:
Luis, 21, is a very enthusiastic, hardworking young man.  He lives in La Tinguiña District in Ica, Perú.  This district is noted for its agriculture, especially cotton growing, as well as the charisma and kindness of its inhabitants.  Like all good Peruvians he enjoys our country’s typical food very much; one of his favorite dishes is the very delicious “Arroz con Pollo.” When he has free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors in the neighborhood very much.  He studied up to fifth grade of secondary school but would have like to have studied Mechanical Engineering.

Day to day Luis goes out to work as a driver.  He spends about 8 hours daily and may take care of up to 40 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very kind to his customers and because there are many customers since the school term is now is in session.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to make the down payment to buy his own mototaxi since the one he currently drives is leased.  With this improvement his income will increase and he will be able to have a vehicle of his own to continue striving every day to reach his greatest dream:  “To have a house of his own, a house and to form a family.”

loans.use: to pay the downpayment on his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Carlos Hernando

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 21 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío Pedregal Alto Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Y solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Carlos es la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral en una parte de su domicilio, además se dedica a labores agrícolas, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad, su madre se dedica a la agricultura y lo apoya en sus actividades
El monto solicitado del crédito será de 800 nuevos soles y  será para  la compra de alimentos para sus ovinos y aves de corral, además para realizar mejoras en su corral, esto le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old, single, and does not havechildren. He lives in his own house, which is located in the small town of Pedregal Alto, in the district of Tambo Grande. He lives in a rural part of the district. He only has the basic service of electricity.

The economic activity in which Carlos works is raising sheep and domestic fowl at his home. He also works in agricultural labor. He has more than 5 years of experience in this business. His mother also works in agriculture and she supports him in his work.

The requested amount for the loan is 800.00 nuevos soles (PEN) which will be for buying food for his sheep and domestic fowl. He will also make improvements to his corral. This will allow him to continue growing in his business and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed for fattening his animals and making improvements to his corral.

loans.name: Victor Alejandro

texts.es:
Victor es un joven muy entusiasta y sobre todo trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y por tener unos maravillosos atractivos turísticos, los cuales son las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas, reciben en todo el año infinidad de turistas, los cuales regresan maravillados por lo hermoso de la flora y fauna que allí habita. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro País y por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “”estofado de pollo”; cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho dibujar y sobre todo pintar combinando colores; ello le gusta mucho y además lo distrae cuando tiene alguna preocupación; el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado muchísimo estudiar para ser Diseñador Grafico.

Con mucho esfuerzo día a día Victor trabaja en su negocio de servicio de decoración, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas a la semana ya que especialmente su trabajo son los fines de semana ya que en estos días siempre hay fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, bautizos, entre otros; él puede atender hasta 5 clientes a la semana; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy detallista y sobre todo creativo en su trabajo, por ello siempre lo recomiendan y es conocido por los clientes.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ala ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar fundas para sus decoraciones, así como también telas; con esta mejora el podrá dar un mejor servicio teniendo el material adecuado, así el podrá seguir trabajando día a día y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio en el mercado de su ciudad y crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Víctor is an enthusiastic, above all, hardworking young man.  He lives in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its hot climate and for having some wonderful tourist attractions: the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum.  Year-round tourists are welcomed who return amazed by the beauty of the flora and fauna found there. 

Like all good Peruvians he enjoys our country’s typical food very much and one of his favorite dishes is the very delicious “Estofado de Pollo.”  When he has free time he likes to draw, above all, combining colors.  He likes that very much and besides it distracts him when he’s worried about something.  He studied up to fifth grade of secondary school but would have liked to have studied to become a Graphic Designer.

With much effort Víctor works day to day in his decoration business.  He works about ten hours per week since he mainly works on weekends because that’s when children’s parties, weddings, baptisms, among others take place.  He can take care of up to five customers per week.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very detail oriented and above all creative in his work and this is why he’s always being recommended and is known by the customers.

Víctor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given him he will be able to buy chair covers for his decorations as well as tablecloths.  With this improvement he will be able to provide better service having adequate materials to continue working day to day to attain his greatest dream:  “To have a place of his own in his city’s market and to grow in his business.”

loans.use: to buy chair covers and tablecloths.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer está conformado por diez emprendedores que ya han venido trabajando con fundación león 2000, estos emprendedores tiene cada uno sus negocios, durante el  crédito otorgado han demostrado ser personas con metas en la vida y deseos de superación. Yolanda es parte de este grupo y su actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de tortilla, está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como maíz, cal, leña, bolsas entre otros productos para la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en: The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" [New Dawn] is made of of ten entrepreneurs that have been working with Fundación León 2000.  They each have their own business.  Through the loans they have been offered, they have proven themselves to be people with goals in life and desires of getting ahead.  Yolanda is a part of this group, and she sells tortillas.  She is requesting financing to buy products like corn, lime, firewood, bags, and other items to make her tortillas.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Pirayu Calle Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Pirayú Calle, debido a que así se llama la capilla que se encuentra cerca de sus casas, han asumido el compromiso de mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de responsabilidad. Actualmente se encuentran en el octavo ciclo con calificación excelente, integrado por 18 mujeres quienes invierten sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Herma es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la costura, y cuenta que este ha sido su medio de vida hace ya un tiempo. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia dándoles lo que necesitan para tener una vida digna.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank has the name “Pirayú Calle” because that is the name of the chapel that is near their houses. They have taken the commitment of keeping the group together and working under this responsibility. They are currently in their eighth loan cycle and have excellent qualifications. The group is made up of 18 women who invest their loans in their respective businesses. 

Herma is one of the members. She works in sewing and she tells us this has been her way of making a living for a while. Thanks to this work she has been able to get ahead and help her family, giving them what they need to have a dignified life.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, threads, glues, and other materials that she needs to continue filling her client’s orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, glues, and other materials.

loans.name: Josè Felipe

texts.es:
José es un hombre  de 32 años de edad, casado y con 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos. La cual está ubicada en el Caserío San Pedrillo del  Distrito de  Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla el José es la ganadería y agricultura; el ganado al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Tiene 0.75 has de terreno agrícola, las cuales están sembrada con limón y mango de la Var. Kent la cual se encuentra en producción. Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral.
El monto solicitado del  préstamo será de 2000 nuevos soles y  se destinara para la compra de  calaminas para mejorar su vivienda y compra de fertilizantes para su huerto.
texts.en:
José is a 32-year-old man who is married and has 2 children in his charge. He lives in his own house, with his wife and children. Their house is located in the small town of San Pedrillo, in the district of Tambogrande. He lives in a rural part of the district and does not have basic services.

José’s business is cattle and agriculture. When the cattle reach an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market. He has 0.75 hectares of agricultural land, which are planted with lime and Kent mango trees, which are producing. His wife raises domestic fowl.

The amount requested for the loan will be 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN), and it will be used to buy tin roofing to improve his house and to buy fertilizers for his orchard.

loans.use: to buy tin roofing to improve his house and to buy fertilizers for his orchard.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, vive en casa propia, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, actualmente  vive en el Caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope .su cónyuge es agricultor y le apoyo en la canasta familiar.
La actividad que realiza Teresa es la venta como ambulante de pescado, el cual compra en el Terminal de Santa Rosa y lo comercializa en los caseríos de Mórrope. Clienta vende al contado y al crédito, cuenta con clientela fidelizada. Adicionalmente clienta cría y vende animales.
El monto solicitado del  préstamo será de 3000 nuevos soles y  se destinara para la compra de  pescado y poder atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa, 46, is married and owns the home where she lives with her two children in the village of Fanupe in the Nuevo neighborhood, 15 minutes from the city of Morrope. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him with the household expenses.

Teresa sells fish door-to-door. She buys it in Santa Rosa and sells it in the villages around Morrope. She sells on cash and credit and has loyal customers. She also raises and sells animals. The 3000 nuevos soles will be used to buy fish so she can take care of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

location.town: Caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca - Morrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité Kuña Katupyry, se formo en la Ciudad de Caaguazú, actualmente estan en Décimo Primer ciclo, es un grupo conformado por señoras humildes con ganas de salir  adelante, y esto es posible gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya les brinda. Con un compromiso grupal  de trabajo en equipo, de solidaridad y responsabilidad conjunta saben que pueden lograr sus objetivos.
La Presidenta del Grupo es la Sra. Hilaria, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños,  esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, por los que lucha dia a dia para darles una vida digna.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, ya que tiene varios pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry communal bank, formed in the city of Caaguazú, is currently in its eleventh loan cycle.  It is a group made up of modest women with a desire to get ahead.  This is possible thanks to the support that Fundación Paraguaya gives them.  They know they can achieve their objectives with a group commitment to working in teams, supportively and responsibly.

The president of the group is Hilaria.  She works selling clothing for women, men, and children.  She is married and has four children for whom she struggles every day to give a decent life.

She is requesting the loan to buy garments to stock up and be able to meet customer demand, because she has several orders that she would like to be able to fill.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
La Sra. Raimunda  tiene ahora 35 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 4 hijos, nació en la provincia de Andahuaylas Apurímac – Perú, pero actualmente vive en Andahuaylillas Distrito de la Provincia de Quispicanchis en Cusco – Perú.
La actividad de la señora Raimunda es la venta de Golosinas, ella vende sus productos  en una carreta en la esquina de la av. principal de Andahuaylillas cerca al mercado de la localidad. La socia en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos para su negocio, como dulces, bebidas, galletas y otros, ella también vende leña su casa. 
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Señora Raimunda is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and they have four children. She was born in the province of Andahuaylas Apurimac, Peru, but she now lives in the Andahuaylillas district in the province of Quispicanchis in Cusco, Peru.

Señora Raimunda's business is selling sweets. She sells her products from a cart on the corner of the main street of Andahuaylillas near the local market. At this time she wants a loan to invest in the purchase of products for her business, such as candies, beverages, crackers, and other items. She also sells firewood from her home.

This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras," which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her snack cart

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra, es una mujer joven de 30 años, soltera, que vive junto a sus padres en  "Los Bancos" que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Su principal obstáculo ha sido el no poder haber terminado su formación académica ya que únicamente cursó la secundaria. Debido a las necesidades económicas y a su espíritu emprendedor, desde hace 5 años abrió su local de productos plásticos y bisutería.

Alejandra desea un crédito que le permita arreglar su casa y además comprar mercadería para su local. De esta manera podrá ampliar la oferta de productos de su local y con ello poder pagar el crédito que también servirá para arreglos de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alejandra, a young woman of 30, is single and lives with her parents in Los Bancos, a rural area in the province of Pichincha which is home to the capital of Ecuador. One of the main natural resources in Los Bancos is water. Countless streams and springs begin in that region and later turn into rivers of considerable size. There is a lot of commerce in the town, most of which happens on the main street where there are hotels, restaurants and shops, largely selling agricultural products as well as veterinary services and basic household goods. 

Her main obstacle has been not having completed her formal education because she only finished high school. Due to financial need and her entrepreneurial spirit, 5 years ago she started selling plastic products and jewelry.

Alejandra wants a loan so that she can make improvements to her home and also buy merchandise for her store. That way she can increase the products she offers which will help her to pay off the loan that will also help her fix her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home and buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 63 años de edad, viuda, vive en casa propia en el sector El Gañan - Caserío Punto 9, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.
La actividad que realiza la María es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en la parte exterior de su domicilio.  Cría pavos, patos, chanchos, chivos y ganado vacuno. Quincenalmente  negocia sus animales. Adicionalmente se dedica  a la agricultura. Tiene sembrado arroz.
El  monto solicitado del crédito es de 2000 nuevos soles y  será para la compra de fertilizantes para  su cultivo de arroz y compra de alimentos para sus animales, lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mará is 63 years old, is a widow, and lives in her own house in the sector of El Gañan, in the small town of Punto 9, located 15 minutes from the city of Lambayeque. 

María raises and sells livestock, which she raises in her back yard. She raises turkeys, ducks, pigs, goats, and cows. She sells animals every two weeks. She also works in agriculture. She has rice planted.

The amount requested for the loan is 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) and it will be for buying fertilizers for her rice and to buy feed for her animals. This will allow her to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy ferlizers and feed.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer de 37 años de edad de  estado civil soltera domicilia en el caserío el Horcon del distrito de Túcume.
La actividad comercial  a  la que se dedica Simona es la crianza y venta de animales, cuenta con experiencia de  03  años. Adicionalmente brinda servicio de costura, además posee clientes sólidos en la zona.
El monto solicitado del  préstamo será de 500 nuevos soles y  se destinara para la compra de  animales, alimentos, arreglo de corral y compra de tela; actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente al comercio de animales, que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en:
Simona is a 37 year old single woman who lives in the small neighborhood of El Horcón in the district of Túcume. The business activity to which Simone dedicates herself is the raising and selling of animals. She has 3 years of experience. Additionally, she offers sewing services and has a solid client base in the area.
The requested loan amount is 500 nuevos soles (PEN), and it will be used for the purchase of livestock, feed, repair of the pens, and to buy fabric; currently, she plans to expand her inventory concerning her livestock business, which is a very profitable activity in the region.

loans.use: to purchase feed, livestock, repair pens, and to buy fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She sells firewood and charcoal from home; her primary customers are her neighbors. Mwanajuma joined Yehu to get enough capital for her business. She aspires to hire employees in the future.

She plans to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en: Tawah lives in Gardnersville. She is 20 years old, single, and she is a high school graduate. For a few years now, she has been selling rice ,oil, pepper  and others items in the market. She enjoys her business because its makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and others items for her business. Her plan is to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and others items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 26 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho, in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 4 years, Emma has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells molasses that the locals drink. 

To help expand his business, Emma has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more molasses for making drinks for resale, and will help Emma to generate greater profits and to add more stock in his shop. Emma hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Emma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more molasses for making drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 22 years old, single and lives in Gardnersville with her 7-year-old child, who is in school. She stopped her education at 10th grade.

For the past three years, she has been running a table market where she sells pepper, vita, salt, onion, palm oil and other items in the local market. She started this business from her savings at the time that she was selling boiled eggs. She likes the ways her customers buy from her and the profit she generates each day.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, vita, salt, onion, palm oil and other items for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, vita, salt, onion, palm oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Kroeun

texts.en:
Kroeun lives in Kandal province. She is 56 years old and a mother of eight. Two of her children are staying with the family. One of them is still in school; another one does not study and helps her do the housework and grow vegetables for selling. 

Kroeun has been planting cabbage and green peppers for about 20 years. The income generated from selling all those vegetables is for supporting her family and affording her kid’s school fees. 

Kroeun has been with VisionFund since 2011, and this is her second loan with VisionFund. She requested the loan to buy vegetable seeds. Kroeun strongly hopes that this loan enables her to grow good-quality vegetables so that she can sell them for a good price, and as a result, her family can live happily and in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary is 39 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area of the Mongkol Borey district. Of the four children, she has two sons working in construction. She and her husband earn a living through subsistence farming. They have been in this business for almost 18 years. Sometimes they work for others for pay.

Nary's group consists of five members who are all female. Nary has been with VisionFund for four years, while the other four group members have been with VisionFund for one to three years. Nary's past loans have enabled her to raise her standard of living to another level. She can now earn up to 25,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day from her current source of income. Successfully repaying her loans with VisionFund, Nary is leading her group to apply for a loan and will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her crop yields so she can earn a larger income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Mbovu

texts.en: Mbovu is a married man who has six children between the ages of 18 and 36; three are enrolled in school. Mbovu operates a meat goat business (i.e., goats for meat production) and has been in this business for the last five years. He sells his goats at the market, and he describes high transport costs as his major challenge. He intends to use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more goats to sell. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is a 57-year-old rural farmer and she is married. She lives with her husband and her children in a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. Out of her four children, she still has two dependent daughters to take care of and they are still in school. She earns a living through farming rice on one hectare of farmland and planting cassava on one hectare of farmland as well. She has been in this business for almost 30 years. She has been challenged by price fluctuations for her crop yields for several years, which affected her income.

Oun's group consists of three members and she is the leader of the group. Oun has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles while her group members have been with VisionFund just for one loan cycle. Now she can earn up to KHR 12,000 from her current business to make a living. She and her two group members are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 Khmer Riels and 1,200,000 Khmer Riels each respectively. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her business and also hopes to keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 50 años de edad, no esta casada pero tiene 5 hijos. Su actividad principal de la señora Mercedes es la venta de comida, ella tiene un puesto de comida ambulante en una de las ferias más importantes y concurridas de su comunidad.
Mercedes en esta oportunidad desea el préstamo para poder comprar mobiliario para restaurante, como utensilios de cocina y algunos muebles, los cuales servirán para dar mejor atención a sus clientes y proporcionar comodidad a su negocio.
La señora Mercedes desea hacer crecer su negocio y ampliarlo, pero esta vez en un local propio. Ella pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la Ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Mercedes was born in the city of Cusco and is 50 years old. She is not married, but she has 5 children. Mercedes’ main work activity is selling food; she has a mobile food stall in one of the most important and popular outdoor markets in the community. 

On this occasion, Mercedes wants a loan so that she will be able to purchase restaurant furnishings, like kitchen utensils and some furniture, which will be used to better serve her customers and make her business more comfortable.

Mercedes wishes to make her business grow and expand, but this time in her own location. She belongs to the communal bank “Señor de los Temblores II” in the City of Cusco – Perú.

loans.use: to buy restaurant furnishings.

loans.name: Kon

texts.en:
Kon is 41 years old and is married. She has three children (two daughters and one son) who are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming rice on her three hectares of farmland for almost 18 years in a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. She can earn a daily income of up to 16,700 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day, of which she can save 6,700 KHR each day for future needs.

This is Kon's first loan with Kiva's field partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,200,000 KHR, which she plans to use to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and increase her crop yields. She also hopes to be able to keep her children in school with the income earned.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Orene

texts.en:
Orene is 35 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Orene has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells soft drinks like soda and passion fruits. 

To help expand his business, Orene has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks for resale, and will help Orene to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Orene hopes that in the future he will be able to borrow more money again after completing this loan. 

Orene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Orene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a woman with four children, all attending school. She sells charcoal from her home, and dreams of starting a firewood business. She has been in the business for two years and describes theft to be her major challenge. Saumu lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She joined Yehu to get access to capital. She plans to use the loan of KES 50,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es: La socia Alicia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, la socia sigue teniendo el restaurante y sigue vendiendo comida como por ejemplo almuerzo y cena. Con el anterior préstamo la socia pudo incrementar el capital del negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, arroz, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member who continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” with Asociación Arariwa. She still manages her restaurant where she serves food for lunch and dinner. With her previous loan, she was able to increase her operating capital. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, and other items.

Alicia is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 25 años, es muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por ser alberge de personas muy luchadoras y sobre todo con un corazón bondadoso, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello su platillo favorito es la riquísima Carapulcra; con mucho esfuerzo logro tener estudios superiores, se graduó de profesor, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Medicina veterinaria.

Día a Día Julio trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo respetuoso con los clientes.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar sus trámites para la obtención de su título universitario como profesor, con lo cual el podrá trabajar en lo que ha estudiado y así mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Ser un buen profesional”.
texts.en:
Julio, age 25, is a hardworking and enthusiastic young man who lives in the District of Parcona. He is known for being a very determined individual and having one of the kindest hearts. Like any good Peruvian, he enjoys traditional food. His favorite dish is the flavorful "carapulcra" (a spicy stew made with pork, chicken, and potatoes).

Julio is working hard to complete his higher education and graduate to become a teacher. However, he would have liked to have studied veterinary medicine. Each day Julio works in his business as a taxi driver. He works approximately eight hours a day and is able to serve 20 customers. Julio believes that he is doing well in his business because he is very friendly and always respectful of his customers.

He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the overwhelming support they have provided so that he can fulfill the requirements to obtain a university degree and become a teacher. Once he is able to work in his field of study, Julio will be able to improve his income and press forward toward his greatest wish of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay for his university degree requirements.

loans.name: Edison Rolando

texts.es:
Edison es un hombre de 25 años que vive junto a su madre en "Latacunga" que es la capital de la provincia de "Cotopaxi" ubicada en el centro del Ecuador. Este sector, el cual se encuentra en plena cordillera de los andes, tiene una población muy tradicional y dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería. En Latacunga, por encontrarse a unos 2.800 metros sobre el nivel del mar el clima suele ser gélido, pero en el subtrópico, en el lado occidental de la provincia, el clima es cálido húmedo por su cercanía a la región costanera del país. Una de las fiestas más sonadas y populares es la de la "Mama Negra" en la cual es propiamente la independencia de Latacunga, sin embargo la celebración va más allá ya que es una mezcla de religión, manifestaciones paganas, españolas e incluso africanas; por este motivo, la celebración cuenta con un gran colorido que se representa en el desfile tradicional que se da a cabo en septiembre, en los días 23, 24, día del equinoccio de otoño.

Edison se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza de animales, actividad que la aprendió de su madre. El no ha tenido la oportunidad de estudiar por lo que únicamente ha cursado la educación primaria. Edison ha tomado la decisión de convertirse en chofer profesional y de esta manera trabajar manejando transporte pesado o de servicio público o privado y así percibir mayores ingresos. Esta actividad le atrae mucho ya que le gusta manejar. Con el crédito que obtendrá podrá pagar su curso y su licencia profesional, de tal manera que pueda cumplir su meta a corto plazo. En su tiempo libre seguirá dedicándose a sus animales y para ello también tendrá la ayuda de su madre.
texts.en:
Edison is a 25-year-old man who lives with his mother in Latacunga, the capital of the province of Cotopaxi, located in the central part of Ecuador.  This region, in the middle of the Andes, has a very traditional community dedicated mainly to agriculture and livestock.  In Latacunga, which is at 2,800 meters above sea level, the climate tends to be cold, but in the subtropics, on the western side of the province, it is warm and humid because of its proximity to the coastal region of the country.

One of the most talked-about and popular festivals is the one for Mama Negra, which is precisely the independence of Latacunga.  Nevertheless, the celebration goes beyond that because it is a mixture of religion with pagan, Spanish, and even African influences.  For this reason the celebration has a lot of color that is represented in the traditional parade that takes place in September, on the 23rd and 24th, the day of the fall equinox.

Edison has worked for three years raising animals, a job he learned from his mother.  He has not had the opportunity to study, so he only finished his primary education.  Edison has made the decision to become a professional driver.  In this way he will work driving heavy transport or in public or private service, and get greater income.  This job is very attractive to him because he likes to drive.

With the loan he will get he will be able to pay for his course and his professional license, so he will be able to achieve his short-term objective.

In his free time he will continue working with his animals, for which he will have the help of his mother.

loans.use: to be able to pay for his professional driver's license.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Aged 48, Sina is a married mother of three children who all are still in school. She lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is a farmer who has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland for almost twenty years. She supplements her income by planting cassava on one hectare of farmland. Having earned a living as a farmer, she has been challenged by unhealthy rice crops and pests.

Sina, who has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, is now leading a group of four female members. Two of her group members have just been with VisionFund this loan cycle while the other one has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The past loans have helped Sina to afford to renovate her old house. She now can earn up to KHR 18,000 per day from her current business. Having successfully paid back the loans, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She sells firewood mostly to her neighbors, and has been doing so for the last three years. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her major challenge is high transport costs. Alice aspires to hire employees in the future. With the loan of KES 25000, she intends to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Carlota Irma

texts.es: La socia Carlota sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella sigue dedicándose a la panadería, ella continua teniendo su horno donde elabora panes y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria. Con el anterior préstamo ella pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y le fue muy bien. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, levadura y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Carlota is still an active member of the communal bank "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa" at the Arariwa Association, and she continues with her bakery, making bread which she sells as a street vendor.  The previous loan was used to increase her working capital and it proved successful.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, yeast and other items.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, sugar, yeast and other items.

loans.name: Marìa Cecilia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de  34 años de  edad estado civil casada, con 2 hijos menores, vive con sus hijos y  conyugue la calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura .ubicado en anexo Arbolsol alto s/n – distrito de  Morrope es una zona rural a 30  minutos de Lambayeque.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es la  crianza y comercio  de  animales, además cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en dicha actividad; el negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela.
 El monto solicitado del préstamo es de 1500 nuevos soles y  se destinara para compra de animales (porcinos, caprinos, aves de corral)  y compra de alimento para los mismos; lo cual le va permitir seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 34, is married and lives with her husband and their two minor children.  The quality of life in the community is about survival.  Most people work independently in commerce and livestock farming, and also in agriculture.  The community is in the Arbolsol Alto annex in the district of Morrope, a rural area 30 minutes from Lambayeque.

María's business is raising and selling livestock, a trade she has been involved in for ten years.  She carries out business on her own property and has her own clientele.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN, which she will use to buy livestock (pigs, goats, chickens) and animal feed so she can continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Kimyi's Group

texts.en:
Aged 37, Kimyi is a married mother of four children who all are still in school. She lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is a farmer who has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland for 8 years. She supplements her income by planting cassava on a half hectare of farmland. Having earned a living as a farmer, she has been challenged by price fluctuations for her cassava crops. 

Kimyi has been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles, while the others are just with VisionFund this loan cycle. Kimyi was selected as the leader of the group. The past loans have helped Kimyi to afford to buy a plot of farmland. She now can earn up to KHR 12,000 per day from her current business. Having successfully paid back the loans, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Samuel has been working hard to manage his wholesale shop, which sells soft drinks like soda and passion fruits. 

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of soda for resale, and will help Samuel to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Samuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Samuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda for resale

loans.name: Rehemah

texts.en:
Rehemah is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Rehemah has been working hard to manage her stationery business, selling books, pens, and printing paper. 

To help expand her business, Rehemah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more printing paper and books for resale, and will help Rehemah to generate greater profits and expand her business. Rehemah hopes that in the future she will be able to be the best service provider in the community. 

Rehemah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehemah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more printing paper and books for resale

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and expand her business. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her profits. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aidah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio nació en la ciudad del Cusco, es un joven de 22 años de edad, está soltero y su principal actividad es hacer servicio de taxi en la ciudad.

Antonio necesita del préstamo para comprar repuestos para su vehículo y de esa manera dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Antonio está seguro que en un tiempo más, el podrá adquirir un nuevo carro con el sus ingresos mejorarán. El pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Antonio was born in the city of Cusco.  He is 22 years old, single and earns a living providing taxi service in the city.

Antonio is in need of spare parts for his vehicle so he can offer his customers better service.

He is sure that in the future he will be able to buy a new car when his income improves.  He belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II" in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Percy Roberto

texts.es:
Percy es un hombre de 34 años de edad  de estado civil conviviente, con 2 hijos menores en edad escolar, vive en casa propia con su conviviente, la zona donde vive es rural, cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica
Percy se dedica al servicio de transporte publico (mototaxi), adicionalmente posee otra unidad vehicular, la cual la da a trabajar; tiene mas de 05 años de experiencia en este rubro. 
 El monto solicitado del préstamo es de 1500 nuevos soles y será para mantenimiento de una de sus unidades de transporte y arreglos en su vivienda, Percy  ha ido creciendo poco a poco con la ayuda de los créditos otorgados por nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Percy is 34 and has a common-law wife and two school-aged children.  They live in their own house in a rural area with running water and electricity.

Percy has a motor-taxi business and also has another vehicle which he rents out.  For over five years he has been in business.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to pay for maintenance for his vehicles, and to renovate his house.  Little by little, Percy has been able to grow his business thanks to the loans provided by our entity.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance for his motor-taxi and to renovate his house.

loans.name: Mayamu

texts.en:
Mayamu is thirty-one years old and lives in Gardnersville with three children between the ages of two months and fifteen years. Two of them are in school. She has been selling rubber dishes (bowls, cups and plates) for the past two years. She learned this way of selling from her mother. 

Mayamu is requesting a loan to buy more rubber dishes (bowls, cups and plates) for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes (bowls, cups and plates) for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is twenty-nine years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling both second-hand and new clothes. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is fifty years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, one of them currently in school. For the past twenty years, William has been working hard to manage his small bar where he sells drinks made out of local brew. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet and pots for use in making the local drink, and will help William to generate greater profits and expand his business. William hopes that in the future he will be able to build a house for himself. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more millet and pots that will be used to make the local drink.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel es un joven de 27 años de edad originario de Estelí, soltero, realizo estudios hasta el tercer año de secundaria, de oficio agricultor específicamente se dedica a la siembra de chiltomas. Inicio su actividad desde hace 10 años en la siembra de tabaco en sociedad con otras personas de su misma comunidad, luego de la ganancia que sacaba decidió  independizarse se dedico  a la siembra de chiltomas desde los  17 años de edad siendo este su primer negocio propio donde recibe el apoyo de su madre y sus hermanos, sus productos los comercializa en la misma comunidad y en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí. Le gustaría que sus productos sean comercializados en los supermercados para venderlos a un mejor precio.
Sus expectativas son ampliar el área de siembra y diversificarla con diferentes tipos de productos. Realiza el préstamo para comprar insumos como plaguicidas, abono, fertilizante y el pago de mano de obra para sembrar 1 manzana de chiltomas. El estima que el préstamo le ayudara ya que podrá cubrir los gastos de insumos y mano de obra obteniendo a la vez buenos rendimientos en la cosecha, sus planes futuros es construir su propia vivienda debido a que actualmente vive con sus abuelos, como metas próximas espera poder llegar a sembrar 2 manzanas de chiltomas con el objetivo de obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Manuel is a young man from Esteli who is 27 years old and unmarried.  He studied up until the third year of high school.  Now he works in the agricultural sector, and specifically devotes himself to planting sweet peppers.   He began this profession 10 years ago planting tobacco with other people from his same community.  With his earnings he decided to become independent and has been devoting himself to the planting of sweet peppers since he was 17 years old.  This was his first business and he had the support of his mother and his brothers.  He sells his products within the same community and in the town of Pueblo Nuevo in Esteli.   He would like his products to sell in the supermarkets so that he could sell them at a better price.  

His expectations are to expand his plot area and diversify it with different types of products.  He will utilize the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as pesticides and fertilizers and to pay laborers to plant one plot of sweet peppers.  He believes that the loan with help him be able to cover the costs of the agricultural inputs and the work force while at the same time obtaining good yield from the harvest.  His future plans are to construct his own house, since right now he is living with his grandparents.  His short-term goals are to be able to plant two plots of sweet peppers with the objective of obtaining a better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as pesticides and fertilizers, and to pay laborers to plant a plot of sweet peppers.

loans.name: Difasi

texts.en:
Difasi is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Difasi has been working hard to manage his retail shop that sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Difasi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, like sugar, for resale, and will help Difasi to generate greater profits and expand his business. Difasi hopes that in the future he will be able to be the richest man in town. 

Difasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Difasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities, like sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora alejandrina tiene 62 años de edad, es una mujer viuda, pero trabajadora. Su actividad principal es la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante que tiene en su domicilio, actividad muy sacrificada y que demanda de mucho tiempo y sacrificio.

En esta oportunidad la señora Alejandrina esta solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y adicionalmente a este, poner un deposito de cerveza, el cual mejorará significativamente sus ingresos.

La señora Alejandrina pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandrina is 62 years old.  She is a widow, but a hard worker.  Her main activity has been selling food in a small restaurant she has in her house.  This activity has proven very demanding as it has required a lot of time and sacrifice.  

With this opportunity Mrs. Alejandrina is asking for a loan to expand her business.  In addition to the restaurant, she would like to sell beer, which would significantly better her income.  

Mrs. Alejandrina is a member of the Community Bank “Señor de los Temblores II” in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy beer in order to start selling it [in her restaurant].

loans.name: Athanael

texts.en:
Athanael is 37 years old and married with 4 children. He sells cassava flour, and his business is open from 8am until 7pm everyday except Sunday. He currently employs one person to help him, and has five years of experience in this work.

Athanael has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cassava flour for resale. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future, reinvest in his business, and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 25 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en el caserío 8-4 Bajo Cruceta en el distrito de Tambogrande, siempre se ha dedicado a la ganadería y agricultura.
La actividad que desarrolla el Rafael es la crianza de animales menores y al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi donde trabaja todos los días, además cuenta con experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, su madre lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza. 
El monto solicitad del préstamo es de 2500 nuevos soles y será para la compra de alimentos para engorde de animales y realizar mantenimiento y compra de llantas de su mototaxi, lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is 25, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the hamlet of Bajo Cruceta in the Tambogrande district. Rafael has always worked in animal husbandry and agriculture. He breeds small animals and also transports passengers in his mototaxi, activities which he carries out every day. He is experienced at running his own business and also receives help from his mother. 

Rafael has applied for a loan of 2500 PEN so that he can buy food to fatten up his animals and carry out maintenance work on his mototaxi. He also wants to buy tires. This will allow him to keep growing his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: buy food to fatten up his animals and carry out maintenance work on his mototaxi

loans.name: Missael Antonio

texts.es:
