Missael de 25 años de edad es originario de Sebaco-Municipio de Matagalpa actualmente vive en Estelí, casado,  de oficio comerciante se dedica a la elaboración y venta de rosquillas desde hace 2 años, realizo estudios hasta el segundo años de universidad. Inicio su actividad desde los 12 años como vendedor ambulante de rosquillas, luego a la edad de 23 años decidió independizarse dedicándose a la elaboración de rosquillas trabajando en unos hornos comunales, hoy en día con esfuerzo propio y apoyo de la familia ha logrado construir sus propios hornos aunque le falta remodelar y acondicionar el taller ya que su capital no le  ajusta para terminar de construir, sus productos son comercializados en  Managua, Jalapa y Carazo aunque también le gustaría que fueran comercializados en los supermercados ya que allí el producto se paga a un mejor precio. 
Solicita el préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su propio taller de rosquillas, el cual estima le ayudara ya que podrá ahorrarse los que paga en el alquiler de los hornos además de que podrá ampliar la producción de rosquillas, sus planes futuros es terminar la construcción de sus hornos y poder remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Missael is 25. He originally comes from the municipality of Sebaco in Matagalpa but now lives in Estelí. He is married and is a shopkeeper by trade. 

For two years Missael’s job has consisted of making and selling doughnuts. He studied for two years at university but first started working aged 12, selling doughnuts in the street. When he was 23 he decided to start his own doughnut-making business. He worked in a communal bakery but now, thanks to his own efforts and the support of his family, he has managed to build his own bakery. It still needs to be remodelled and fitted out, since Missael ran out of money before he was able to finish. 

His products are sold in Managua, Jalapa and Carazo. He would like them to be sold in supermarkets too, where they could command a higher price.

Missael has applied for a loan so that he can buy construction materials to finish building his own bakery. A loan would allow him to save on costs, since he currently pays to rent ovens. It would also help him to increase production. His plans for the future are to finish building his bakery and to renovate his home.

loans.use: buy construction materials to finish building his own bakery

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovanna es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, con su esposo y sus 02 menores hijos, la cual esta ubicada en el Jr Lima 725 del Distrito de Tambogrande .actualmente  vive en la parte  urbana de este distrito. Y cuenta con servicios básicos como luz eléctrica y agua
La actividad que desarrolla Giovanna  es la venta de abarrotes, en su propio domicilio en la cual atiende permanentemente a clientes conocidos de la zona. Además como actividad secundaria realiza venta de productos de belleza, ambos negocios los realiza hace 03 años. Su esposo es chofer, pero lo apoya a su esposa en todas sus actividades que realiza. 
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 2500 nuevos soles y lo necesita para invertir en compra de artículos de primera necesidad ( arroz, azúcar, aceites, bebidas, et ) y compra de productos de belleza, ya que cuenta con clientes ya establecidos en la zona, y poder mejorar su condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 35, married and has two children. She lives in her own home with her husband and two small children in the Tambogrande district. Since she lives in an urban zone, she has basic water and electricity services.

Giovanna works from home, where she sells groceries. She has a steady stream of customers from the surrounding area. She also sells beauty products as a secondary activity. She has been running both of these businesses for three years. Her husband is a chauffeur but he also helps his wife with her businesses. 

Giovanna is applying for a loan of 2500 PEN. She plans to use it to buy basic staples such as rice, sugar, oil, drinks etc. and beauty products, since she has a loyal customer base in the local area. This will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (basic staples) to stock her shop

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia Guillermina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de golosinas y pasteles, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y busca las mejores oportunidades para darles a sus hijos una calidad de vida buena. En esta oportunidad Guillermina requiere el préstamo para comprar pasteles, tortas, golosinas y otras cosas más. 

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Guillermina continues as a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa" community bank.  She continues selling candies, cakes and pies.  She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who provides for her family and seeks out the best opportunities for giving her children a good quality of life.  On this occasion, Guillermina needs a loan to buy cakes, pies, candies and other items.

Guillermina is very grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy cakes, pies, candies, etc.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia María sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella sigue dedicándose a la elaboración y bordado de capas y ropa para santos y vírgenes, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y busca las mejores oportunidades para darles a sus hijos una calidad de vida buena. En esta oportunidad María requiere el préstamo para comprar hilos, agujas y telas. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María continues as a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa" community bank.  She continues making and embroidering cloaks and clothing for people taking part in 'Santos y Vírgenes' celebrations.  She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who provides for her family and seeks out the best opportunities for giving her children a good quality of life.  On this occasion, María needs a loan to buy embroidery floss, needles and fabric.

María is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy embroidery floss, needles and fabric

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos jóvenes. 
Celia se dedica al comercio ambulatorio de golosinas. Ella vende productos como caramelos, galletas, bebidas gaseosas chicles etc. Celia realiza esta actividad hace varios años y es de esta manera que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, por ello en esta oportunidad está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para su comercio, ella sabe que trabajando duro como lo hace, pronto podrá tener otro modulo como punto de venta, que le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos.

La señora Celia pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Celia is 51 years old, married, and has three young children.

Celia's business is selling sweet treats as an itinerant vendor.  She sells products such as candies, cookies, soda, gum, etc.  She has been in this line of work for several years and it is how she has managed to provide for her family.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business because she knows that if she continues to work hard as she does now, she will soon have another unit as a sales outlet.  This will help her to increase her income.

Celia is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores II” community bank which is located in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tables, chairs and other furniture

loans.name: Gardenia Antonia

texts.es:
Gardenia es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 1 pequeño de 1 año y 3 meses el cual es su motivo de vivir y por el cual ella trabaja para darle lo mejor y que sea mejor que ella, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por encontrase en la selva peruana y en la cual se puede apreciar flora y fauna maravillosa, sobre todo por la calidez y amabilidad de su gente y por su clima cálido. Cuando Gardenia dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con su pequeño y de vez en cuando le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche.

Con mucho carisma y esfuerzo Gardenia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños; ella trabaja alrededor de 13 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha paciencia y sobre todo por su amabilidad.
Gardenia esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, como blusas, fajas, pantalones, faldas, entre otros por campaña del día de la madre; así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Culminar su carrera y darle una buena educación y calidad de vida a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Gardenia is a very hardworking woman and the mother of one son who is a year and three months old. He is her reason for living and she works hard to give him the best and for him to be better than her. Her house is in the city of Pucallpa, a city found in the Peruvian jungle where marvelous flora and fauna can be seen and where the people are friendly and the weather is warm. When Gardenia has free time, she likes to go out with her son and sometimes eat her favorite dish, the delicious ceviche.

With much charisma and hard work, Gardenia works at her business selling clothes for women, men and children. She works around 13 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers a day. She believes that the business is going well for her because she has a lot of patience and above all friendliness.
Gardenia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have offered she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business such as blouses, girdles, pants, and skirts among others, for Mother's Day. In this way, she will be able to improve her income and be able to keep fighting every day to be able to make her biggest dream come true: "finish her education and give her son a good education and a good quality of life".

loans.use: to buy merchandise (such as skirts, blouses and more).

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y hace muchos años se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de productos tales como golosinas en general y bebidas como gaseosas y refrescos, en su carretilla la cual le sirve como punto de venta para sus productos, esto en una de las calles de la ciudad del Cusco.
La señora Adelaida necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y surtir su carretilla de golosinas, ahora que el año escolar ya ha comenzando y es su principal mercado.
La señora Adelaida pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 59 years old and married.  For many years she has been selling products such as candies, soda and soft drinks as an itinerant vendor.  She sells her products from a cart which she locates in a street in the city of Cusco.  Adelaida needs a loan to buy merchandise so that she can stock her cart with candies.  The school year has now begun and students are her main market.

Adelaida belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores II” community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (candies) and stock her cart

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella sigue dedicándose a la venta salchipapas y ceviche, ella sigue vendiendo de forma ambulatoria en su carreta, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y busca las mejores oportunidades para darles a sus hijos una calidad de vida buena. En esta oportunidad Maribel requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como pescado, limón, papas, pollo, salchicha y otras cosas más. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel continues as a member of Asocación Arariwa's “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” community bank.  She continues selling 'salchipapas' (Peruvian fast food) and 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish).  She continues making her sales as an itinerant vendor from her cart.  She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who provides for her family and seeks out the best opportunities for giving her children a good quality of life.  On this occasion, Maribel needs a loan to buy supplies such as fish, lemon, potatoes, chicken, sausage and other products.

Maribel is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fish, lemon, potatoes, chicken, sausage, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre muy trabajador, junto a su esposa tiene 3 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y son su razón de vivir; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, conocida como la ciudad del sol eterno, ya que en cualquier época del año tiene un clima cálido y acogedor; tiene como actividades principales la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva y sobre todo por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. 

Con mucho esfuerzo día a día Victor trabaja en su negocio de carpintería, en especial elaboración de muebles, puertas y ventanas; el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 3 clientes en el día, dependiendo del tipo de trabajo que realice; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo cumplido.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera y melanina  para la realización de sus trabajos, así el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo y poder seguir luchando día a día para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos y que su negocio sea más grande”.
texts.en:
Victor is a very hard-working man.  He and his wife have three children who they love very much and who are their reason for living.  Their home is located in the city of Ica which is known as the city of eternal sunshine because it enjoys a warm and welcoming climate year round.  The city's main business activity is agriculture, especially the growing of cotton, asparagus and grapes.  It is also well known for the kindness of the locals.

Victor works very hard every day in his carpentry business where he makes furniture, doors and windows.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to three customers.  It all depends on the type of work he is doing.  He believes that his business is going well because he is very kind and polite to his customers.

Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy wood and melamine so that he can carry out his work.  This means that he will have available all the materials he needs and will be able to continue working hard every day to fulfill his biggest dream: to provide his children with a good quality of life and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wood and melamine

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia Delfina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida como por ejemplo ceviche, ella vende sus platos de comida en su carreta de forma ambulatoria, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y busca las mejores oportunidades para darles a sus hijos una calidad de vida buena. En esta oportunidad Delfina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pescado, limón, cebolla, sal y otras cosas más. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Delfina continues as a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” community bank and she continues selling food such as 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish).  She sells her meals from a cart as an itinerant vendor.  She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who provides for her family and seeks out the best opportunities for giving her children a good quality of life.  On this occasion, Delfina needs a loan to buy supplies such as lemon, onion, salt and other items.

Delfina is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fish, lemon, onion, salt, etc.

loans.name: Melvina

texts.en:
Melvina is 39 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and has two children who are in school and live at home.

Melvina has been selling rice and palm oil for the past seven years. She learned this trade from her mother. Her main challenge is the high cost of the goods. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. She would like to own her own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Las Duquesas Group

texts.es:
Las Duquesas, es un grupo formado por entusiastas mujeres que viven en el municipio de Ciénega de Flores. Original nombre tomado de la cortesía y el buen trato que existe entre ellas. 
Petra, es una nueva integrante en este grupo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano. Recolecta y vende dentro de la colonia. Ella se vio motivada a comprometerse con un crédito para hacer crecer su negocio debido a las ventas están mejorando y desea invertir para distribuir y ofrecer ropa de primera, nueva y para con ello impactar un nuevo mercado.
Petra se encuentra en búsqueda de crecimiento y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Las Duquesas is a group of enthusiastic women who live in the town of Ciénega de Flores. The original name was chosen for the courtesy and good treatment they have for each other.
  
Petra is a new member of this group. She sells second hand clothes. She collects and sells within the neighborhood. She was motivated to commit to a loan to make her business grow because sales are improving and she wants to invest to distribute and offer new spring clothing to impact a new market.    

Petra is seeking growth and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in spring clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La señora Serafina tiene 48 años de edad está casada y tiene 4 hijos. la señora Serafina junto con su esposo tienen un taller de Planchado y pintura de vehículos, y precisamente para ello están necesitando un préstamo, para comprar material para su taller.
La señora Serafina y su esposo esperan poder construir su casa con el fruto de su trabajo en el de su taller.
Serafina pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Serafina is 48 years old, married, and has four children.  She and her husband have an auto body painting and repair shop.  They need this loan for their business, so that they can buy materials.

Serafina and her husband hope to be able to build their own home as the result of their work in this busienss.  

Serafina belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores II” community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials for her auto repair shop

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of them currently in school. For the past twelve years, Madina has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Madina to generate greater profits. Madina hopes that in the future she will be able to become wealthier. 

Madina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Madina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Delmar

texts.es:
Delmar es un joven de 20 años el cual es muy trabajador, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del año, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva y esparrago, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, en ocasiones cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear y distraerse un poco. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica.

Día a día Delmar sale a trabaja como chofer de mototaxi por las calles de la ciudad, el se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas y puede atender hasta 25 clientes; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque le pone mucho empeño todos los días para poder llevar un apoyo a su casa.

Delmar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar fundas para los asientos, autoradio y parlantes para acondicionarlos a su vehículo, lo que permitirá que los clientes se sientan más a gusto en su vehículo y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de mecánica”.
texts.en:
Delmar is a 20 year old man who is very hardworking. He lives in the city of Ica, a city characterized by its warm and pleasing climate all year long. There is agriculture there, especially growing cotton, grapes and asparagus. Like a good Peruvian, he likes his country's traditional food. That is why one of his favorite dishes is the delicious "Chicken and Rice". Sometimes, when he has free time, he likes to go out and have fun. Due to his lack of financial resources, he was only able to go to school up to the fifth year of secondary school, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering.    

Day to day, Delmar goes out to work as a motorcycle taxi driver on the city streets. He works at this business around 12 hours a day and can serve up to 25 customers. He believes that it is going well for him in the business because he is very friendly to the customers and above all because he works very hard to be able to support his home.  

Delmar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their support he can buy seat covers, a radio and speakers for his vehicle. This will allow his customers to be more  pleased in his vehicle and for him to improve his income. This way, he can keep working and fighting every day to make his biggest dream come true: "to have an auto-mechanic business".

loans.use: to buy seat covers, a radio, speakers and more.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is a 36-year-old widowed woman who lives with her four children in Dornogovi province in Southern Mongolia. Three of her children are studying at the secondary school while the youngest child goes to kindergarten. She has been working hard to feed her children since she was widowed. 

In 2009 Erdenetsetseg started selling vegetables. She buys various types and varieties of vegetables at wholesale in the capital, then sells them at her town’s large trade center. She has already made many regular customers not only in the local area but in neighboring provinces. 

Erdenetsetseg is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to purchase vegetables in large quantities so that I could save on transportation expenses. I am planning to open an ice cream shop soon and will start saving for my daughters' college education." Erdenetsetseg is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT from XacBank to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a 28-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. His wife is on maternity leave. 

Batjargal has started making doors, upper frames for gers (a traditional Mongolian dwelling), furniture, and other necessary parts for traditional gers. Also, he makes traditional instruments and souvenirs. He has lots of experience in this area as he has been making this type of furniture for 17 years. He always aims to produce the best quality furniture for his customers. 

Batjargal is an open-minded man who says that "I would like to improve my business activities by purchasing the necessary materials for the business. I am planning to make some furniture for my own ger this year." The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy the necessary materials for his production business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for his production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the requirements to obtain a driver's license.

loans.name: Dagiimaa

texts.en:
Dagiimaa is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her mother and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Both of her children attend school, one in college and the other in secondary school. 

Dagiimaa, who started a vegetable retail business in 2008 at a well-positioned counter, has been gradually improving her enterprise and paying for the children's tuition fees. A diligent woman, she says, "I would like to expand the business by purchasing some vegetable and seeds in large quantities. I have a further plan to finish building my house."  The total amount she is requesting is 700,000 MNT to purchase the vegetables and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable and seeds.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Mbaye est un chimiste qui tient à domicile un atelier de production de produits chimiques.Il loue également des batteries de véhicules et fait le montage,le dépannage et l'installation de réseau d'électricité solaire. Il est marié mais n'a pas d'enfants.Il exerce cette activité depuis 1981 après avoir été formé par un technicien étranger.Aujourd'hui, cette activité lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille et d'épargner une partie de ses bénéfices dans son compte de l'UIMCEC.Afin de renforcer sa production, il sollicite un pret de 300 000 francs pour acheter du gasoil, des solvants, du diluant de base, du sucre et des emballages. Son ambition est de monter une grande unité de production.
texts.en:
Mbaye is a chemist who maintains a chemical production workshop at his home.  He also rents vehicle batteries and does solar energy network assembly, repair, and installation. He is married but has no children. He has been conducting this business since 1981, after having been trained by a foreign technician. Today, this business allows him to assume responsibility of the expenses for the care of his family, and to save a portion of his profits in his UIMCEC account.

In order to increase his production, Mbaye is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs in order to purchase diesel, solvents, thinner, sugar, and packaging materials. His dream is to establish a large production unit.

loans.use: To purchase diesel, solvents, thinner, sugar, and packaging materials.

loans.name: C 8072 Coabunya Iv Group

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 28 years old and married with two children between 3 and 7 years old. He owns an agriculture business selling sorghum and maize. His business is open from 6 am until 7 pm every day. He currently employs three people to help him.

He is the leader of the group called "C 8072 COABUNYA IV" in the local language. He is pictured with a paper in his hand and he has 10 years of experience in this work. 

Jean Baptiste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy fertilizer to use in his agriculture business to cultivate more sorghum and maize to sell. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future, to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees. He hopes to renovate his house with his profits.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to use in his agriculture business to cultivate more sorghum and maize to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: C 8070 Coabunya Iii Group

texts.en:
Celestin is 39 years old and married with two children. He takes care of five relatives. He owns an agriculture business selling tomatoes from 6 am until 5 pm per week except on the weekend. He currently employs four people to help him. He is the leader of the group called "C 8070 COABUNYA III" in the local language. He is pictured with a paper in his hand and he has two years of experience in this work. 

Celestin has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy fertilizer to use in his agriculture business to cultivate more tomatoes to sell. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future, to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to use in his agriculture business to cultivate more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 26-year-old Lebanese single woman who lives with her parents and three siblings. Two of them are working.  With the cooperation of her father, Fatmeh has been able to cover their heavy costs of life. 

She opened her own bakery many years ago. She has delicious food and a good place. Today, she wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate her bakery. She notes that this will improve her place, which will enable her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to expand her bakery.

loans.use: to renovate her bakery.

loans.name: Hachem

texts.en:
Hachem is a 24-year-old Lebanese, engaged man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. After finding it hard to cover his family expenses he decided to double his effort and combine forces with his parents. Hachem started his own work as a painter in 2006, on a free-lance basis. He’s a reputable man, known for his good and well organized work.

Today, Hachem is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L. to purchase added painting supplies for his business. This Kiva loan will improve his work and allow him tp start his new project properly.  In the future, he plans to open his own paintings shop.

loans.use: to purchase added painting supplies for his business.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has big responsibilities to his family, especially his children. He has been working in a wheels shop since 1996. He wants a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s study fees. He would be pleased to see them achieve high educational levels. He plans to use future Kiva loans to continue covering his children’s educational fees.

loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en: Taleb is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, who are in school. He supports his family and covers his children’s educational costs. Taleb has owned a coffee shop since 2009. People meet at his business to enjoy coffee with friends. He wants a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new coffee machine for his business. This new machine would facilitate his work and allow him respond rapidly to his customers’ orders. He plans to enlarge his shop and welcome a wider range of customers.

loans.use: to purchase a new coffee machine for his business.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en: Layal is a 30-year-old Lebanese married woman. She’s living with her husband who has owned a carpentry business in order to be able to fulfill their needs. They have two children who are still attending school. Layal started to work as a beautician in 2003 from her home. She has her loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and elegant style. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to rent a shop and expand her business as well. She notes that this will improve her work and allow her to attract additional clients. In the future, Layal plans to take more Kiva loans and buy her own beauty shop.

loans.use: to rent a shop and expand her business as well

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 24-year-old Lebanese man who lives with her parents.  He has four siblings, who two of them are working. He’s a brave and talented young man looking for a better and shiny future. 

He decided to start his own business in 2009. So he opened a barber shop.  He’s friendly and knows how to gain and stay in a good relations with his clients. 

Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new barbering tools for his salon. This kiva loan will certainly allow him to carry on his work properly.  In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his salon.

loans.use: to purchase new barbering tools for his salon.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a twenty-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and three siblings. He’s trying his best and working hard in order to be able to get married and have his own family. After several years of experience in charcoal trading, Ahmad decided to start working on his own on a free-lance basis in 2010. 

Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the quantity of charcoal needed for his business. This Kiva loan will boost his business and increase his sales as well. In the future, he plans to open his own charcoal shop.

loans.use: to purchase the quantity of charcoal needed for his business.

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj, 42, produces diary products such as milk, yogurt, butter and dried curds with his wife. Then he sells them to customers in the market. This is a business what is the main income source for his family. He has been running his business for 2 years and he has been trying to gain enough experience in his business. He lives with his 3 children and his wife in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic yurt, in a district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.
 
Dagvadorj wants to improve his business through the packaging of his products which meets with the hygienic requirements. It will be the standardized goods packaging. His products do not have any dedicated packaging currently. Now he needs the equipment to package goods of various types and sizes. Principally, he is planning to use recyclable brown paper for his products packaging. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase packaging equipment and packing raw materials.

loans.use: buy food packaging equipment and supplies

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 26 years old, single and lives with seven family members, three of whom work.

Amjad has owned a shop since 2009, selling and repairing mobiles phone. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a 1,200 USD as "youth loan" in order to renovate his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali lives in Iraq, is youth client aging 26 years old, married and has one child. Since 2009, he has earned a living as a barber, working in his own shop, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is also located in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $2,400 as "youth loan" to renovate and redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his barber shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali lives in Iraq, where he is a youth client who is 28 years old and married. Since 2009, he has earned a living by running a shop where he sells fabric used in women's clothing. He has experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He also has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas. He is requesting a $3,000 as "youth loan" to pay his annual rent and buy more goods to sell. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: In order to pay his annual rent and buy more goods to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is 27, single and lives with two family members. He has owned a dairy since 2006, from which he derives milk products to sell. Due to his father’s dairy work, he is well experienced in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.

Hamza is requesting a 1800 USD as "youth loan" from ASCI in order to buy a Friesian cow. With increased profits, he hopes to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a Friesian cow.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 21 years old, single, and lives with nine family members; five of them work.

Ali has been an owner of a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a “youth loan” in order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 25 years old, married, and lives with two family members; one of them works.

Hasan has been an owner of a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fishes, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a “youth loan” in order to renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 21, married, and lives with nine family members; three of them work.

Ahmad has been an owner of a food market since 2002, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a “youth loan” in order to purchase a small electric generator and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a small electric generator and  to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 21 years, single, and lives with seven family members;  four of them work.

Hasan has been an owner of a store selling electronics supplies since 2009. He has a sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $2400 as a "youth loan" in order to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 26 years old, married and he has one child. He lives with five family members; one of them works.

Fadel has owned a carpentry workshop since 2005, making bedroom sets, living room sets and doors. He has more than seven years' experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for $3000 as a “Youth loan" in order to purchase carpentry machines. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry machines.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein lives in Iraq. He is a youth client who is 27 years old, married and has two children. Since 2010, he has earned a living by running a women's clothing shop. He has experience in this field, a good reputation and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He is also well known in the surrounding area. He has applied for a $3,000 as a "youth loan" in order to repair and fix his shop’s floors and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s floors and walls.

loans.name: Clever Alberto

texts.es:
Clever es un hombre muy alegre, tiene 36 años, es padre de 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años, a los cuales quiere muchísimo y son su razón de vivir y salir adelante; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del año, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo Escabeche.

Clever trabaja con mucho esmero en su negocio como chofer de taxi, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y trabajador.

Clever está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han enviado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vehículo y poder apoyar a su esposa en su negocio de venta de cosméticos; lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir adelante para poder realizar su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Clever is a very happy man.  His is 36 years old and the father of two children, ages 13 and 11.  He loves them very much and they are his reason for living and moving forward.  His home is located in the city of Ica, a town that is characterized by its warm and welcoming climate at all times of the year.  Like a good Peruvian, Clever loves the typical food of his country and for that reason one of his favorite dishes is the tasty Escabeche.

Clever works with great effort in his business as a taxi driver.  He works around 12 hours per day and he can carry up to 30 clients per day.  He believes he is doing well in his business because he is very friendly and hard-working.

Clever is very grateful for the Kiva loans since thanks to their help he has been able to improve his car and support his wife in her business of cosmetic sales.  This helps Clever improve his income and get ahead in order to accomplish his big dream: "To give his children a good education."

loans.use: To improve his vehicle and to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuya, fifty-three, works as a dispatcher in a bus depot. She lives with her husband and he works with his wife as a bus driver. All of their children have moved out and live on their own. 

Mrs. Enkhtuya and her husband live in a ger district in their old house which was built a long time ago. Since it was built it has had no repairs done to it. Therefore Mrs. Enkhtuya has decided to make renovations to her house this spring and summer. It will cost about 1.800.000 MNT according her calculations. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the materials needed for renovating her house. She also plans to insulate the walls so as to reduce the loss of heat. She believes that she will be able to reduce the use of coal which produces smoke after she has put in the insulation. This is her first loan and she really hopes to have a good house by using the loan.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials necessary to renovate her house.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: This borrower, Nour, is from Iraq. She is a youth client aged 24 years old and is married and has one child. Nour has been a tailor since 2005; she professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats, and trousers for women. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. Nour has a good reputation and she is becoming well known in the surrounding areas. She is requesting a $1200 youth loan to purchase a tailoring machine. She aims to earn more profits to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Dulguun

texts.en:
Mr. Dulguun, 21, lives with his grandmother on their plot of land with a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Since last autumn, just after he graduated school, he has been working as a watchman in the metallurgy factor. 

His grandmother is aged and in the winter time she always feels cold in her ger. Therefore, her grandson Dulguun decided to have a small house for them. He is planning to build his house this spring and summer. Also he has a plan of making insulation for the walls. As he said, it is very important and beneficial to cut the smoky coal usage in the winter time. It is also a good contribution to reducing the air pollution around the city. 

It will cost about 1,300,000 MNT to buy the building materials for his new house. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to building a small house.

loans.use: to build a small house.

loans.name: Anwar Group

texts.en:
Rwayda  is the featured borrower for Anwar's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. Rwayda sells clothes and shoes in her house, to take good care of her three children, and at the same time help her husband in making their living and covering most of their expenses.
Rwayda is a hard working woman she does her best to please her customers and works hard to keep them satisfied.
Rwayda is a 32-year-old mother applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new Spring-Summer Clothes and Shoes Collection.
Rwayda is working hard on expanding her business, and hopes to stay in good health to keep on taking care of her children and investing more in her business.

loans.use: To buy new spring-summer clothes and shoes collection

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 23-year-old single mechanic from Ain. He is a hard worker, talented in his business and well known in the region.

Rabih has been working in auto repair for twelve years. He was only eleven years old when he first started working. His childhood wasn't joyful enough for a kid and that's why Rabih insists on developing his business as much as he can to avoid seeing his future kids the way he did. And that's why Rabih didn't make a family yet, until he feels that he is financially ready for this step.

Rabih is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary equipment for his business.

This is Rabih's second experience as a Al Majmoua borrower; his first loan helped a lot in improving his business, and he is also a  borrower in good standing.

loans.use: To buy necessary equipment for his business

loans.name: Odtuya

texts.en:
Odtuya, 54, works as a driver in the mining site. For many years, he has been working as a miner in a province far away from his home. He lives with his wife, his daughter, and son-in-law on his plot the land, which is in the ger district (ger is a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent) of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. 

Since last year, he has been building a new small house on his plot of land, behind the old one. But he lacked some money to buy the roof flat boards. He  also has a plan of adding insulation to the walls. As he said, it is very important and beneficial to cut the smoky coal usage in the winter time. It is also a good contribution to reducing the air pollution around the city. 

The loan Odtuya is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the building materials to build a new good house on his plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase the building materials to build a new good house on his plot of land.

loans.name: Yolanda Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Frontera De Urvavisa.

En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 17, 15, 12, 9 y 5 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es maestro constructor.

Ella trabaja en una casa en la ciudad realizando quehaceres domésticos y en sus ratos libres se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y realiza sus ventas puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que una vez que sale de su trabajo ella visita a sus clientes para cobrar y ofrecer sus productos ya que vende a crédito y cobra por semanas, lleva más de 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la mercadería se la envían de Quito cada vez que ella necesita.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido financiar su negocio y ganarse algo por su cuenta para ayudar a sus hijos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean personas de bien y profesionales.

En la foto esta la socia con su hija.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank "La Frontera de Urvavisa" meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo. This city with its green mountains and enchanting landscapes has been known for many years as "Ciudad del Valle" (the City of the Valley).

Sra. Yolanda lives in this place. She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children (ages 17, 15, 12, 9, and 5). The older children are in high school while the younger ones attend elementary school. Her husband is a master builder. Yolanda works at house in the city, where she performs the domestic chores. In her spare time, she operates her business of selling clothes of all types. She sells door to door and says that she visits her customers as soon as she leaves from her job. Yolanda extends credit when she offers her products and collects payment on a weekly basis. She has been in business for more than five years and has done very well. Her merchandise is shipped in from Quito as needed.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and other garments. Yolanda has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have funded her business. As a result, she has been able to earn something so that she can help her children. Her dream is for her children to become successful and professional people. In the photograph, Yolanda is shown with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children, age 13 and 11 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

Aminata works seven days a week and 10 hours each day in her food market. She earns about SLL 1,400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000. Aminata has already received and successfully repaid her first loan and now requests a new loan in order to purchase more drinks. 

Aminata plans to send her children to university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
At 22, Jesus attended community college and became a certified mechanic in his hometown of Mexico City. Today, at 60, he lives in El Paso, Texas, and operates his own business, L-Garage.

When he first started in business, Jesus rented a facility and picked up on the trade he learned in his native country. He soon began attracting regular customers who returned time and time again to his shop. 

After 25 years of entrepreneurship, Jesus visited an ACCION Texas Inc. office in his neighborhood, inquired about a loan, and was approved. This is his first loan with ACCION, and he plans to use the funds to update his shop’s equipment.

At L-Garage, Jesus employees three other mechanics and plans to hire more as his business expands.

loans.use: to upgrade his shop equipment.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be a God-fearing woman. She operates a retail store where she sells mobile accessories and provides services of M-pesa transaction services to customers. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy fast growing market, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power from customers due to the high prices of mobile accessories. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy mobile accessories and increase float for M-pesa transaction. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop dealing with mobile accessories within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy mobile accesories and increase float for the M-pesa transcation to customers.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 4 months to 11 years. She describes herself to be polite and persistent. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a fast growing slum area  and her primary customers are local residents from the slum. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of charcoal. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bags of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a charcoal distributor in the neighborhood town. She hopes that in the future she will be selling charcoal in bulk.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 32 years old and is married. He has four children and he takes care of six relatives. 

He sells various goods such as soap, cooking oil, biscuits, sugar, etc., and his business is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. per week except on the weekend. He currently employs three people to help him and he has three years of experience in this work. 

Gratien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as soap, cooking oil, biscuits, sugar, etc., to sell. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as soap, cooking oil, biscuits, sugar.  etc., to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 30 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of them currently are in school. 

For the past two years, Fredrick has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Fredrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar, beans and maize flour for resale, and it will help Fredrick to generate greater profits. Fredrick hopes that in the future he will be able to to educate his children. 

Fredrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fredrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar, beans and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. She describes herself as a polite woman. 

She operates a pharmacy where she sells drugs such as syrups, tablets and creams. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a busy, viable shopping center and her primary customers are patients. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the pharmacy. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy drugs and laboratory equipment. Her business goal is to run many pharmacies.

loans.use: to buy drugs and laboratory equipment.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 34-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is 17 years old. She describes herself to be a focused and God-fearing woman. She operates a retail store where she sells pesticides and detergents. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of raw materials used to make detergents. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase pesticides and detergents. Her business goal is to run a soap manufacturing company within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and detergents.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 33-year-old married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be a visionary and determined man. He operates a retail store where he sells electronics and also provides camera repair services. He has been involved in this business for over ten years and employs one staff member. His business is located on a busy street, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand the business. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase mechanical tools for repairing electronics. His business goal is to run many  similar retail stores.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools for repairing electronics.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 43-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 9 months to 17 years. He describes himself to be a determined, visionary and aggressive man. He operates a retail store where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 25 years and employs 3 staff members. His business is located along a busy and viable street in town, and his primary customers are women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his retail shoe store business. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy leather. His business goal is to attract many customers by increasing his stock. He hopes that in the future he will use the anticipated profits to build a house and buy land.

loans.use: to buy leather for making shoes to sell.

loans.name: Geofery

texts.en:
Geofery is 32 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past three years, Geofery has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Geofery has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and it will help Geofery to generate greater profits and expand his business. Geofery hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children. 

Geofery is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Geofery who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Gunga

texts.en:
Gunga is a 38 year old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 6 months to 20 years. He describes himself as a social and honest man. 

He operates a motorcycle with which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a viable area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds and the poor road network, which is impassible during rainy season. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle to increase his modes of transportation. His business goal is to have many motorcycles  within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages 20 and 26 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a retail stall  where she sells scrap metals. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Previously, she was involved in providing transportation services, using a taxi. Her primary customers are manufacturers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for expanding the business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy scrap metals. Her business goal is to run a manufacturing company of metals.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 33-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be a determined and focused woman. She operates a retail store where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located in a fast growing urban area, and her primary customers are local residents from the surrounding area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying meat. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more meat. Her business goal is to run many more butcher shops within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will build a house with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is 36 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, ages 19, 16 and 13.  In 2002, she established her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Sita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 67 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 43 and 22.  In 1990, she established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Gevork

texts.en:
Gevork is a 53-year-old farmer from the Akhaltsikhe district in the southern part of the country. He is married and lives with his wife, Astkhik, as well as his mother and younger sister. Astkhik is a housewife while Gevork’s mother is retired. His sister has health problems and receives a pension from the government. 

Gevork is the only income provider in the family. He earns a living through agriculture. He grows potatoes on a family-owned plot of land. Also, the family has an apple garden. Gevork works hard on the plot and the garden during the spring and summer. He sells harvested potatoes and apples in the village, to local retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 GEL, including the pensions of Gevork’s mother and sister. 

Gevork is requesting credit to buy potato seeds. He has cultivated his land and fertilized it. Now he will sow potatoes. Gevork hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable, enabling him to reap a good harvest in the summer. After selling the harvest he will make money, which will be used for financing the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad es originaria de León, casada, se dedica a la  agricultura específicamente a la siembra de yuca y maíz, madre de 7 hijos, ella realizo estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Inicia su actividad a los 19 años con la crianza de cerdos luego se dedico a la agricultura a la siembra de yuca y maíz actividad en la que cuenta con 35 años de experiencia y dominio, recibe el apoyo de su esposo que le ayuda con la siembra, sus productos los comercializa en su misma comunidad, sus expectativas son crecer en su negocio y seguir con la crianza de animales. Realiza el préstamo para la preparación de una manzana y media de tierra para sembrar yuca el cual le  ayudara ya que podrá comprar los insumos necesarios para la preparación de las tierras tales como plaguicidas y obtener una buena siembra, sus planes futuros son sembrar sus productos y seguir con la crianza de cerdos y gallinas para vender  con el objetivo de obtener más ganancias para buscar un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and originally from León. She is married and the mother of seven children. Maria is a farmer who specifically grows cassava and corn. She completed her education through the second year of elementary school. Maria started her business at 19 by raising pigs. She later became a farmer by planting cassava and corn, and now she has 35 years of experience in this line of work. Her husband helps with the planting. Maria's crops are sold in her community. She expects to grow her business and continue raising animals.

Her loan will be used to prepare 1.5 plots of land for growing cassava. This will enable her to buy the necessary supplies for preparing the land, such as pesticides, so that she can achieve a good crop. Her future plans include planting her crops and continuing to raise pigs and chickens to sell. Maria's end goal is to generate more income so that she can achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for growing cassava.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 30-year-old businessman, who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children in between the ages of 10 and 1 year. Three of them go to school. 

Samson runs a mixed goods store business. He has been in the business for 10 years. He has no employees, but his wife helps in selling also. Other than this business, Samson has no source of income.

Samson heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done in the market by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more items like Nomi, bathing soap, tomato paste, sugar, rice and many others. 

In five years time, Samson hopes for a better business by having many products.

His major challenges include low income and the high cost of goods.
 
Samson says that he really appreciates Finance South Sudan for bringing him these opportunities and educating him with business ideas, which are going to enable him to grow financially.

loans.use: to purchase more items like Nomi, bathing soap, tomato paste, sugar, rice and many others.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is a member of the group called Mujeres Unida (united women), located in the city of Samana. This is his 9th loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has had his business for over four years, starting with the first loan he took with Esperanza Internacional. After his last loan, which he invested in his business of selling fried food, he has developed his business. He has paid all his past loans on time. Julio is asking for a loan to improve his house by building a floor, which is now made of ground that he will change for a cement floor. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Julio is a married man with a child, and he is dedicated to his business of selling fried food every morning and night. He is very excited, because with this loan he will provide better conditions in his house that will be healthier for his family. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials to build a floor.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 42-year-old farmer from the Samtskhe-Javakheti region of South Georgia. David lives with his family, including his wife, Maka, and three children (ages 8, 13 and 14) as well as his father, who is retired. 

David leads the agricultural business of the family. He grows potatoes, cabbage and beats on a family-owned plot of land. David works hard on the plot during the spring and summer seasons. He sells harvested vegetables to local retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 GEL.

David has requested credit so he can purchase fertilizers and chemicals to treat the crops for parasites. After properly treating his crops, David will reap a good harvest and sell it through his distribution channels. This will enable him to earn more income from sales than last year. 

David will use the increased income to purchase needed household goods and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals to treat the crops for parasites.

loans.name: Rumano

texts.en:
Rumano is a 28-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children, 3 years old and 4 months old. None of them goes to school. 

Rumano runs a mixed goods and cold drinks store business, and he has been in the business for four years. He has no employees. Rumano has no other source of income except for this business.

Rumano heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done in the market by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more items like juice in the fridge, Nomi, bathing soap and many others. 

In five years time, Rumano hopes to improve his business by having many products and by selling wholesale as well.

His major challenges include a low income rate and lack of a permanent building to be rented.
 
Rumano says that he really appreciated Finance South Sudan for bringing him these opportunities. He is happy because the loan can make him think about building a house for the family and for rent as well.

loans.use: to purchase more items like juice in the fridge, Nomi, bathing soap and many others.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 45-year-old farmer from the Samtskhe-Javakheti region of South Georgia. She lives with her family, including her husband, Revaz, three children (ages 14, 18 and 20) and father, who is retired. 

Manana and Revaz are leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they grow potato and cabbage on a family-owned plot of land. Manana and Revaz work hard on the plot during the spring and summer seasons. They sell harvested vegetables to local retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 GEL.

Manana has requested credit so she can purchase fertilizers and chemicals to treat her her crops for parasites. After properly treating the crops, the family will reap a good harvest and sell it through their distribution channels. This will enable them to earn more income from sales than last year. 

Manana plans to use the increased income to finance the education of her son, who is starting high school this year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals to treat her crops for parasites.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 53 years old. She is from the Adigeni district in the southern part of the country. Tamar is married and lives with her family, including her husband, Vakhtang, 30-year-old son and a daughter-in-law. Tamar and Vakhtang lead the agricultural business of the family. They have a small dairy farm with four milk cows and six calves. Tamar produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. She takes cheese to the market once a week. 

Also, the family owns a plot of land where potatoes are grown. Harvested potatoes are sold on the local market as well. Tamar and Vakhtang are busy during the day with the dairy farm and the seasonal works on the plot. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 GEL.

Tamar has requested credit to purchase potato seeds. They have already cultivated the land and now will sow potatoes. She will purchase quality seeds and reap a good harvest in the summer. Also, Tamar will use part of the received credit to purchase calves.

Tamar and Vakhtang will feed calves for six months and sell the grown calves at a higher price, enabling the family to make a profit. Tamar plans to renovate their house, as it is old and needs repairs.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and calves.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Fe has a shop that sells seafood like fish and sea weed. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy seafood to sell.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy milk fish, flying fish and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Sauya's Group

texts.en:
Sauya's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Sauya is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi, in the Kampala region in eastern Uganda. For the past two years, Sauya has been working hard to manage her small market, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sauya has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sauya to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Sauya hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big wholesale shop. 

Sauya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sauya's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Florrah

texts.en:
Florrah is a resident of the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. She sells brooms in the town. She is a mother of nine children. She started her business from the savings accumulated from her previous retail shop. Florrah also sells water to the residents of Mariakani and has rental houses within the town area. The area is situated along the highway and receives many guests en route to either the Kenyan capital or the coastal towns.

Florrah is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a generator to pump water to sell. The additional income she earns as a result of this loan will help her complete the construction of her guest house.

loans.use: To purchase a generator to pump water to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 32 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jimmy has been working hard to manage his small business selling clothes. 

To help expand his business, Jimmy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Jimmy to generate greater profits to cover medical expenses for his family and other family needs. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Jimmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jimmy, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, macron, soap, heist and biscuits.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children in between the age of 15 and 3 years.  All of them go to school. 

Joice runs a salon business, and she has been in the business for 5 years. She has no employee. Joice heard about Finance Sudan from friends and an advert on the radio. She is taking a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase more items like weaves, dryers and many others. In addition to this business, Joice has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Joice would like to hope to add more weaves and other goods to attract clients.   

Her major challenges include her low income rate and the expensiveness of goods.

Joice says that she appreciates finance Sudan’s effort to reach up to their location.

loans.use: to purchase more items like weaves, dryers and many others

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet's group is made up of four hardworking women. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, Fort Portal, Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her small market, where she sells fresh food. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan for 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.
